          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551929273815,
          "parent_id": "5aafc562-3b71-4de2-bf4b-5eee4c2dd40d",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["The implementation of "],
              ["LIFO", [["b"]]],
              [" is more or less the same as by "],
              ["FIFO", [["b"]]],
              [
                " but we evict the youngest not the oldest page. The program results are:"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      },

      "3c5725cf-c14d-495e-9ebd-cc5bde7e0092": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551929273816,
          "id": "3c5725cf-c14d-495e-9ebd-cc5bde7e0092",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551929273816,
          "parent_id": "5aafc562-3b71-4de2-bf4b-5eee4c2dd40d",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "class LFU : public Strategy {\npublic:\n    LFU() : Strategy(\"LFU\")\n    {\n        for (int i=0; i<cacheSize; ++i) requestFrequency[i] = 0;\n    }\n\n    int apply(int requestIndex) override\n    {\n        int least = 0;\n\n        for(int i=0; i<cacheSize; ++i)\n        {\n            if(cache[i] == request[requestIndex])\n                return i;\n\n            else if(requestFrequency[i] < requestFrequency[least])\n                least = i;\n        }\n\n        return least;\n    }\n\n    void update(int cachePos, int requestIndex, bool cacheMiss) override\n    {\n        if(cacheMiss)\n            requestFrequency[cachePos] = 1;\n\n        else\n            ++requestFrequency[cachePos];\n    }\n\nprivate:\n\n    // how frequently was the page used\n    int requestFrequency[cacheSize];\n};"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 1
        }
      },

      "5e94e94d-ba33-4e9b-808e-0519d6a31e4d": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551929273814,
          "id": "5e94e94d-ba33-4e9b-808e-0519d6a31e4d",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551929273814,
          "parent_id": "5aafc562-3b71-4de2-bf4b-5eee4c2dd40d",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["update", [["b"]]],
              [
                ": After the caller uses the place, it tells the strategy whether it was a miss or not. Then the strategy may update its internal data. The strategy "
              ],
              ["LFU", [["b"]]],
              [
                " for example has to update the hit frequency for the cache pages, while the "
              ],
              ["LFD", [["b"]]],
              [
                " strategy has to recalculate the distances for the cache pages."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "numbered_list",
          "version": 1
        }
      },
      "6147d548-b9c0-417b-aa6a-0874ab050716": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551929273815,
          "id": "6147d548-b9c0-417b-aa6a-0874ab050716",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551929273815,
          "parent_id": "5aafc562-3b71-4de2-bf4b-5eee4c2dd40d",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "class LIFO : public Strategy {\npublic:\n    LIFO() : Strategy(\"LIFO\")\n    {\n        for (int i=0; i<cacheSize; ++i) age[i] = 0;\n    }\n\n    int apply(int requestIndex) override\n    {\n        int newest = 0;\n\n        for(int i=0; i<cacheSize; ++i)\n        {\n            if(cache[i] == request[requestIndex])\n                return i;\n\n            else if(age[i] < age[newest])\n                newest = i;\n        }\n\n        return newest;\n    }\n\n    void update(int cachePos, int requestIndex, bool cacheMiss) override\n    {\n        // nothing changed we dont need to update the ages\n        if(!cacheMiss)\n            return;\n\n        // all old pages get older, the new one get 0\n        for(int i=0; i<cacheSize; ++i)\n        {\n            if(i != cachePos)\n                age[i]++;\n\n            else\n                age[i] = 0;\n        }\n    }\n\nprivate:\n    int age[cacheSize];\n};"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 5
        }
      },
      "6b5587b2-af8a-44d0-afeb-4d68f4fa741d": {

          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["Attention:", [["b"]]],
              [
                " For the following examples we evict the page with the smallest index, if more than one page could be evicted."
              ]
            ]
          },

      "791bad53-8f17-4d4f-b8a9-221303ee237c": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551929273817,
          "id": "791bad53-8f17-4d4f-b8a9-221303ee237c",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",

          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551929273820,
          "parent_id": "5aafc562-3b71-4de2-bf4b-5eee4c2dd40d",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["The "],
              ["LFD", [["b"]]],
              [
                " strategy is optimal, but there is a big problem. Its an optimal "
              ],
              ["offline", [["b"]]],
              [" solution. In praxis caching is usually an "],
              ["online", [["b"]]],
              [
                " problem, that means the strategy is useless because we cannot now the next time we need a particular item. The other four strategies are also "
              ],
              ["online", [["b"]]],
              [
                " strategies. For online problems we need a general different approach."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 5
        }
      },

      "a1c2e9df-c410-420b-a94a-e3060de0919d": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551929273805,
          "id": "a1c2e9df-c410-420b-a94a-e3060de0919d",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551929273805,
          "parent_id": "5aafc562-3b71-4de2-bf4b-5eee4c2dd40d",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "The caching problem arises from the limitation of finite space. Lets assume our cache "
              ],
              ["C", [["c"]]],
              [" has "],
              ["k", [["c"]]],
              [" pages. Now we want to process a sequence of "],
              ["m", [["c"]]],
              [
                " item requests which must have been placed in the cache before they are processed.Of course if "
              ],
              ["m<=k", [["c"]]],
              [
                " then we just put all elements in the cache and it will work, but usually is "
              ],
              ["m>>k", [["c"]]],
              ["."]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      },
      "a29bb60b-d615-4195-a44d-c3e23a619ef1": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551929273819,
          "id": "a29bb60b-d615-4195-a44d-c3e23a619ef1",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551929273819,
          "parent_id": "5aafc562-3b71-4de2-bf4b-5eee4c2dd40d",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["The greedy strategy "],
              ["LFD", [["b"]]],
              [
                " is indeed the only optimal strategy of the five presented. The proof is rather long and can be found "
              ],
              [
                "here",
                [
                  [
                    "a",
                    "https://blog.henrypoon.com/blog/2014/02/02/proof-of-the-farthest-in-future-optimal-caching-algorithm/"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " or in the book by Jon Kleinberg and Eva Tardos (see sources in remarks down below)."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      },
      "a643f239-8811-418e-acc7-22be5f066c07": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551929273814,
          "id": "a643f239-8811-418e-acc7-22be5f066c07",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551929273814,
          "parent_id": "5aafc562-3b71-4de2-bf4b-5eee4c2dd40d",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["FIFO", [["b"]]],
              [
                " just needs the information how long a page is in the cache (and of course only relative to the other pages). So the only thing to do is wait for a miss and then make the pages, which where not evicted older. For our example above the program solution is:"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      },
      "a9e7d89f-2b90-42db-a8dc-3619160a945b": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551929273814,
          "id": "a9e7d89f-2b90-42db-a8dc-3619160a945b",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551929273814,
          "parent_id": "5aafc562-3b71-4de2-bf4b-5eee4c2dd40d",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "class FIFO : public Strategy {\npublic:\n    FIFO() : Strategy(\"FIFO\")\n    {\n        for (int i=0; i<cacheSize; ++i) age[i] = 0;\n    }\n\n    int apply(int requestIndex) override\n    {\n        int oldest = 0;\n\n        for(int i=0; i<cacheSize; ++i)\n        {\n            if(cache[i] == request[requestIndex])\n                return i;\n\n            else if(age[i] > age[oldest])\n                oldest = i;\n        }\n\n        return oldest;\n    }\n\n    void update(int cachePos, int requestIndex, bool cacheMiss) override\n    {\n        // nothing changed we dont need to update the ages\n        if(!cacheMiss)\n            return;\n\n        // all old pages get older, the new one get 0\n        for(int i=0; i<cacheSize; ++i)\n        {\n            if(i != cachePos)\n                age[i]++;\n\n            else\n                age[i] = 0;\n        }\n    }\n\nprivate:\n    int age[cacheSize];\n};"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 1
        }
      },
      "aa3282c7-1b48-4e64-b03b-0c8a6b67925f": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551929273809,
          "id": "aa3282c7-1b48-4e64-b03b-0c8a6b67925f",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551929273809,
          "parent_id": "5aafc562-3b71-4de2-bf4b-5eee4c2dd40d",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["First in, first out (FIFO)", [["b"]]],
              [": The oldest page gets evicted"]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "numbered_list",
          "version": 1
        }
      },
      "ba256ea9-81c4-4fd5-9ead-bfa0d587b58a": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551929273815,
          "id": "ba256ea9-81c4-4fd5-9ead-bfa0d587b58a",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551929273815,
          "parent_id": "5aafc562-3b71-4de2-bf4b-5eee4c2dd40d",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "class LRU : public Strategy {\npublic:\n    LRU() : Strategy(\"LRU\")\n    {\n        for (int i=0; i<cacheSize; ++i) age[i] = 0;\n    }\n\n    // here oldest mean not used the longest\n    int apply(int requestIndex) override\n    {\n        int oldest = 0;\n\n        for(int i=0; i<cacheSize; ++i)\n        {\n            if(cache[i] == request[requestIndex])\n                return i;\n\n            else if(age[i] > age[oldest])\n                oldest = i;\n        }\n\n        return oldest;\n    }\n\n    void update(int cachePos, int requestIndex, bool cacheMiss) override\n    {\n        // all old pages get older, the used one get 0\n        for(int i=0; i<cacheSize; ++i)\n        {\n            if(i != cachePos)\n                age[i]++;\n\n            else\n                age[i] = 0;\n        }\n    }\n\nprivate:\n    int age[cacheSize];\n};"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 5
        }
      },
      "ba34626a-5395-4d00-a8b1-cc6f5bf0f5a5": {

          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["Longest forward distance (LFD)", [["b"]]],
              [
                ": Evict page in the cache that is not requested until farthest in the future."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "numbered_list",
          "version": 5

            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "Strategy: LFD\n\nCache initial: (a,b,c)\n\nRequest    cache 0    cache 1    cache 2    cache miss\n  a          a          b          c    \n  a          a          b          c    \n  d          a          b          d          x\n  e          a          b          e          x\n  b          a          b          e    \n  b          a          b          e    \n  a          a          b          e    \n  c          a          c          e          x\n  f          a          f          e          x\n  d          a          d          e          x\n  e          a          d          e    \n  a          a          d          e    \n  f          f          d          e          x\n  b          b          d          e          x\n  e          b          d          e    \n  c          c          d          e          x\n\nTotal cache misses: 8"

      "e208be12-3b5c-4e9d-bd3b-db7c7af95857": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551929273813,
          "id": "e208be12-3b5c-4e9d-bd3b-db7c7af95857",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551929273813,
          "parent_id": "5aafc562-3b71-4de2-bf4b-5eee4c2dd40d",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "#include <iostream>\n#include <memory>\n\nusing namespace std;\n\nconst int cacheSize     = 3;\nconst int requestLength = 16;\n\nconst char request[]    = {'a','a','d','e','b','b','a','c','f','d','e','a','f','b','e','c'};\nchar cache[]            = {'a','b','c'};\n\n// for reset\nchar originalCache[]    = {'a','b','c'};\n\n\nclass Strategy {\n\npublic:\n    Strategy(std::string name) : strategyName(name) {}\n    virtual ~Strategy() = default;\n\n    // calculate which cache place should be used\n    virtual int apply(int requestIndex)                                      = 0;\n\n    // updates information the strategy needs\n    virtual void update(int cachePlace, int requestIndex, bool cacheMiss)    = 0;\n\n    const std::string strategyName;\n};\n\nbool updateCache(int requestIndex, Strategy* strategy)\n{\n    // calculate where to put request\n    int cachePlace = strategy->apply(requestIndex);\n\n    // proof whether its a cache hit or a cache miss\n    bool isMiss = request[requestIndex] != cache[cachePlace];\n\n    // update strategy (for example recount distances)\n    strategy->update(cachePlace, requestIndex, isMiss);\n\n    // write to cache\n    cache[cachePlace] = request[requestIndex];\n\n    return isMiss;\n}\n\nint main()\n{\n    Strategy* selectedStrategy[] = { new FIFO, new LIFO, new LRU, new LFU, new LFD };\n\n    for (int strat=0; strat < 5; ++strat)\n    {\n        // reset cache\n        for (int i=0; i < cacheSize; ++i) cache[i] = originalCache[i];\n\n        cout <<\"\\nStrategy: \" << selectedStrategy[strat]->strategyName << endl;\n\n        cout << \"\\nCache initial: (\";\n        for (int i=0; i < cacheSize-1; ++i) cout << cache[i] << \",\";\n        cout << cache[cacheSize-1] << \")\\n\\n\";\n\n        cout << \"Request\\t\";\n        for (int i=0; i < cacheSize; ++i) cout << \"cache \" << i << \"\\t\";\n        cout << \"cache miss\" << endl;\n\n        int cntMisses = 0;\n\n        for(int i=0; i<requestLength; ++i)\n        {\n            bool isMiss = updateCache(i, selectedStrategy[strat]);\n            if (isMiss) ++cntMisses;\n\n            cout << \"  \" << request[i] << \"\\t\";\n            for (int l=0; l < cacheSize; ++l) cout << \"  \" << cache[l] << \"\\t\";\n            cout << (isMiss ? \"x\" : \"\") << endl;\n        }\n\n        cout<< \"\\nTotal cache misses: \" << cntMisses << endl;\n    }\n\n    for(int i=0; i<5; ++i) delete selectedStrategy[i];\n}"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 5
        }
      },

            "title": [
              ["LFU", [["b"]]],
              [
                " evicts the page uses least often. So the update strategy is just to count every access. Of course after a miss the count resets. The program results are:"
              ]
            ]
          },

      "f201863a-c6e7-4ae4-9ecf-9d695120a77d": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551929273817,
          "id": "f201863a-c6e7-4ae4-9ecf-9d695120a77d",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551929273817,
          "parent_id": "5aafc562-3b71-4de2-bf4b-5eee4c2dd40d",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["The "],
              ["LFD", [["b"]]],
              [
                " strategy is different from everyone before. Its the only strategy that uses the future requests for its decission who to evict. The implementation uses the function "
              ],
              ["calcNextUse", [["c"]]],
              [
                " to get the page which next use is farthest away in the future. The program solution is equal to the solution by hand from above:"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "text",
          "version": 5
        }
      },
      "f28b0626-73a1-40c7-b26a-89b8f5663615": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1551929273817,
          "id": "f28b0626-73a1-40c7-b26a-89b8f5663615",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1551929273817,
          "parent_id": "5aafc562-3b71-4de2-bf4b-5eee4c2dd40d",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "class LFD : public Strategy {\npublic:\n    LFD() : Strategy(\"LFD\")\n    {\n        // precalc next usage before starting to fullfill requests\n        for (int i=0; i<cacheSize; ++i) nextUse[i] = calcNextUse(-1, cache[i]);\n    }\n\n    int apply(int requestIndex) override\n    {\n        int latest = 0;\n\n        for(int i=0; i<cacheSize; ++i)\n        {\n            if(cache[i] == request[requestIndex])\n                return i;\n\n            else if(nextUse[i] > nextUse[latest])\n                latest = i;\n        }\n\n        return latest;\n    }\n\n    void update(int cachePos, int requestIndex, bool cacheMiss) override\n    {\n            nextUse[cachePos] = calcNextUse(requestIndex, cache[cachePos]);\n    }\n\nprivate:\n\n    int calcNextUse(int requestPosition, char pageItem)\n    {\n        for(int i = requestPosition+1; i < requestLength; ++i)\n        {\n            if (request[i] == pageItem)\n                return i;\n        }\n\n        return requestLength + 1;\n    }\n\n    // next usage of page\n    int nextUse[cacheSize];\n};"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 5
        }
      },
